candidates.title: Converting document IDs to allow any primary key
candidates.body:
This refactoring introduces a new type, DocumentId, which allows any
`Key` implementing type to be used as a DocumentId, with the only
restriction being that DocumentIds are currently limited to 64 bytes in
length.

This restriction is to allow Header to remain copy, and allow it to not
require an external allocation.

Overall the impact to the code isn't that bad, but this is an initial
draft to have a discussion around the idea with other users.

Remaining tasks as of 2-17:
- [x] Consider naming consistency: Id vs PrimaryKey vs DocumentId vs DocumentKey.
- [x] Add example showing custom primary keys.
- [x] Refactor Key to a new location now that it's not view-specific.
- [x] Refactor document.rs into smaller files. Should DocumentId be moved externally so that it can be used in Actionable rules?
- [ ] Add section on PrimaryKey to book
- [x] Update changelog
- [x] Add macro unit tests

candidates.title: Add lz4 compression support
candidates.body:
Closes #185

This is a first pass at compression support. I believe that ultimately
we'll want to support both zstd and lz4, but right now feature flags are
really annoying to implement. When we can implement namespaced features
(#178), we should revisit adding multiple compression backends and
options. lz4-flex has a faster unsafe option that can be enabled
optionally, but I've kept disabled in the spirit of BonsaiDb's "safe"
defaults.

From my research, zstd will be preferred when storage is at a premium,
but lz4 *should* be faster in general. I want to write a good benchmark
suite, because I believe the relative performance will potentially be
hardware dependent, and users should be able to gauge what works best
for them.

candidates.title: Replace OPAQUE with Argon2
candidates.body:
Closes #158

- [x] Remove OPAQUE
- [x] Implement argon2
- [x] Clean up 
- [x] Update documentation
- [x] Create new OPAQUE ticket

candidates.title: Reduce copying by borrowing during view mapping
candidates.body:
This refactor is focused around allowing the view mapping system to avoid extra clones of bytes under the hood. I had originally gone as far as making the network request types also do data borrowing, but I quickly realized that the only way to get data to be able to be sent across a spawn-able task layer is to convert it to a static lifetime -- defeating the original purpose of borrowing.

After those realizations, I settled on having an OwnedDocument type and eliminating `'static` lifetimes in the API as much as I could. The CHANGELOG documents the specific changes, and overall I'm pretty happy with the state of things.

candidates.title: Support deriving Collection
candidates.body:
I also added trybuild to test the error messages of derive macro.

The macro does not check for name validity as the restrictions will be
removed https://github.com/khonsulabs/bonsaidb/issues/143#issuecomment-1019278177.

closes #138

candidates.title: Add 'realistic' commerce benchmark
candidates.body:
In an effort to provide a somewhat meaningful benchmark tool that can
simulate different situations in a transactional environment, this
benchmark aims to simulate operations performed for a commerce
application.

This is still a work in progress.

candidates.title: Implementing Semi-Transactional KeyValue Store
candidates.body:
Closes #120.

- [x] Introduce new background task that keeps changed keys in memory before persisting to disk
- [x] Add configuration for how often to commit keys
- [x] Test various configurations
- [x] Switch to multi-ops for committing keys

candidates.title: Replace serialization with Transmog
candidates.body: This pull request attempts to allow BonsaiDb to have fully pluggable serialization strategies through [Transmog](https://github.com/khonsulabs/transmog).

candidates.title: Switched keystorage to the official aws sdk
Switching to derive_where for some impls
candidates.body:
This will likely be merged ahead of #87, as my understanding is that it will be published in preparation for updating the custodian-password dependencies.

Going to wait to merge this until it has a published version on crates.io.

candidates.title: Add Rust-driven complete test command
candidates.body:
`cargo xtask test` now executes the entire test suite. The matrix that GitHub actions uses is now powered by the same list that command uses.

Refs #29
